definition: to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: She had now the right to be his helpmate in his all kind deeds.
sentences.chinese: 现在，她已成了他一切仁慈行为当仁不让的助手。

sentences.english: When conditions are ripe, the scope of the cases accepted shall of course be responsibly expanded.
sentences.chinese: 当条件成熟时，当仁不让地扩大受案范围。

sentences.english: Then do thy office Muse, I teach thee how.
sentences.chinese: 当仁不让吧，诗神，我要教你怎样。

definition: fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
logical/only to be expected/rational and clearly structured (of text)
